column1: In the decided case of Thajudeen Vs. Sri Lanka Tea Board and Another (1981) 2SLR 471 it was
held  “where  the  major  facts  are  in  dispute  and  the  legal  result  of  the  facts  is  subject  to
controversy  and  it  is  necessary  that  the  questions  should  be  canvassed  in  a  suit  where
parties would have ample opportunity of examining the witnesses so that the Court would
be better able to judge which version is correct.  Writ will not issue.”
